content.rendered: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet. It is a popular styling language which is used with HTML to design websites. It can also be used with any XML documents including plain XML, SVG, and XUL

excerpt.rendered: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet. It is a popular styling language which is used with HTML to design websites. It can also be used with any XML documents including plain XML, SVG, and XUL

title.rendered: What is the origin of CSS?

content.rendered: SGML (Standard Generalized Markup Language) is the origin of CSS. It is a language that defines markup languages.

excerpt.rendered: SGML (Standard Generalized Markup Language) is the origin of CSS. It is a language that defines markup languages.

title.rendered: What are the different variations of CSS?

content.rendered:
Following are the different variations of CSS:

  • CSS1
  • CSS2
  • CSS2.1
  • CSS3
  • CSS4

excerpt.rendered: Following are the different variations of CSS: CSS1 CSS2 CSS2.1 CSS3 CSS4

title.rendered: How can you integrate CSS on a web page?

content.rendered:
There are three methods to integrate CSS on web pages.

  1. Inline method – It is used to insert style sheets in HTML document
  2. Embedded/Internal method – It is used to add a unique style to a single document
  3. Linked/Imported/External method – It is used when you want to make changes on multiple pages.

excerpt.rendered: There are three methods to integrate CSS on web pages. Inline method – It is used to insert style sheets in HTML document Embedded/Internal method – It is used to add a unique style to a single document Linked/Imported/External method – It is used when you want to make changes on multiple pages.

title.rendered: What are the advantages of CSS?

excerpt.rendered: Bandwidth Site-wide consistency Page reformatting Accessibility Content separated from presentation

title.rendered: What are the limitations of CSS?

content.rendered:
• Ascending by selectors is not possible
  • Limitations of vertical control
  • No expressions
  • No column declaration
  • Pseudo-class not controlled by dynamic behavior
  • Rules, styles, targeting specific text not possible

excerpt.rendered: Ascending by selectors is not possible Limitations of vertical control No expressions No column declaration Pseudo-class not controlled by dynamic behavior Rules, styles, targeting specific text not possible

content.rendered:
CSS frameworks are the preplanned libraries which make easy and more standard compliant web page styling. The frequently used CSS frameworks are: –

  • Bootstrap
  • Foundation
  • Semantic UI
  • Gumby
  • Ulkit

excerpt.rendered: CSS frameworks are the preplanned libraries which make easy and more standard compliant web page styling. The frequently used CSS frameworks are: – Bootstrap Foundation Semantic UI Gumby Ulkit

title.rendered: Why background and color are the separate properties if they should always be set together?

content.rendered:
There are two reasons behind this:

  • It enhances the legibility of style sheets. The background property is a complex property in CSS, and if it is combined with color, the complexity will further increase.
  • Color is an inherited property while the background is not. So this can make confusion further.

excerpt.rendered: There are two reasons behind this: It enhances the legibility of style sheets. The background property is a complex property in CSS, and if it is combined with color, the complexity will further increase. Color is an inherited property while the background is not. So this can make confusion further.

content.rendered:
An Embedded style sheet is a CSS style specification method used with HTML. You can embed the entire stylesheet in an HTML document by using the STYLE element. 

<style>    
body {    
    background-color: linen;    
}    
h1 {    
    color: red;    
    margin-left: 80px;    
}     
</style>

excerpt.rendered: An Embedded style sheet is a CSS style specification method used with HTML. You can embed the entire stylesheet in an HTML document by using the STYLE element.

title.rendered: What are the advantages of Embedded Style Sheets?

content.rendered:
• You can create classes for use on multiple tag types in the document.
  • You can use selector and grouping methods to apply styles in complex situations.
  • No extra download is required to import the information.

excerpt.rendered: You can create classes for use on multiple tag types in the document. You can use selector and grouping methods to apply styles in complex situations. No extra download is required to import the information.

content.rendered:
It is a string that identifies the elements to which a particular declaration apply. It is also referred as a link between the HTML document and the style sheet. It is equivalent of HTML elements. There are several different types of selectors in CSS: –

  • CSS Element Selector
  • CSS Id Selector
  • CSS Class Selector
  • CSS Universal Selector
  • CSS Group Selector

excerpt.rendered: It is a string that identifies the elements to which a particular declaration apply. It is also referred as a link between the HTML document and the style sheet. It is equivalent of HTML elements. There are several different types of selectors in CSS: – CSS Element Selector CSS Id Selector CSS Class Selector CSS… Continue reading What is a CSS selector?
Some CSS Style components are: Selector Property Value

title.rendered: What is the use of CSS Opacity?

content.rendered:
The CSS opacity property is used to specify the transparency of an element. In simple word, you can say that it specifies the clarity of the image. In technical terms, Opacity is defined as the degree to which light is allowed to travel through an object. For example:

<style>    
img.trans {    
    opacity: 0.4;    
    filter: alpha(opacity=40); /* For IE8 and earlier */    
}    
</style>

excerpt.rendered: The CSS opacity property is used to specify the transparency of an element. In simple word, you can say that it specifies the clarity of the image. In technical terms, Opacity is defined as the degree to which light is allowed to travel through an object. For example:

content.rendered:
The universal selector matches the name of any of the element type instead of selecting elements of a specific type.

<style>    
* {    
   color: green;    
   font-size: 20px;    
}     
</style>

excerpt.rendered: The universal selector matches the name of any of the element type instead of selecting elements of a specific type.

title.rendered: Which command is used for the selection of all the elements of a paragraph?

content.rendered: The p[lang] command is used for selecting all the elements of a paragraph.

excerpt.rendered: The p[lang] command is used for selecting all the elements of a paragraph.

title.rendered: Name the property used to specify the background color of an element.

content.rendered:
The background-color property is used to specify the background color of the element. For example:

<style>    
h2,p{    
    background-color: #b0d4de;    
}    
</style>

excerpt.rendered: The background-color property is used to specify the background color of the element. For example:

title.rendered: Name the property for controlling the image repetition of the background.

content.rendered:
The background-repeat property repeats the background image horizontally and vertically. Some images are repeated only horizontally or vertically.

<style>    
body {    
background-image: url("paper1.gif");    
margin-left:100px;    
}    
</style>

excerpt.rendered: The background-repeat property repeats the background image horizontally and vertically. Some images are repeated only horizontally or vertically.

title.rendered: Name the property for controlling the image position in the background.

content.rendered:
The background-position property is used to define the initial position of the background image. By default, the background image is placed on the top-left of the webpage.

You can set the following positions:

  1. center
  2. top
  3. bottom
  4. left
  5. right
background: white url('good-morning.jpg');  
background-repeat: no-repeat;  
background-attachment: fixed;  
background-position: center;

excerpt.rendered: The background-position property is used to define the initial position of the background image. By default, the background image is placed on the top-left of the webpage. You can set the following positions: center top bottom left right

title.rendered: Name the property for controlling the image scroll in the background.

content.rendered:
The background-attachment property is used to specify if the background image is fixed or scroll with the rest of the page in the browser window. If you set fixed the background image, then the image not move during scrolling in the browser. Let’s take an example with the fixed background image.

background: white url('bbb.gif');  
background-repeat: no-repeat;  
background-attachment: fixed;

excerpt.rendered: The background-attachment property is used to specify if the background image is fixed or scroll with the rest of the page in the browser window. If you set fixed the background image, then the image not move during scrolling in the browser. Let’s take an example with the fixed background image.
